subject: Learning
title: Error Detection: Catching Your Own Mistakes
description: Learn Error Detection: Catching Your Own Mistakes in one minute.

hook.text: You reread your email and spot three typos you missed on the first pass. Your monitor was offline.

buildup.text: Error detection is the metacognitive ability to notice when something you've produced is wrong.

discovery.text: It requires comparing your output against an internal standardâ€”which means you must know what 'right' looks like.

twist.text: Novices miss errors because they lack the standard. They don't know what they don't know.

climax.text: Building checklists and using peer review compensates for blind spots in self-monitoring.

punchline.text: You can't catch errors you don't expect. Learn the standards first.

quiz.question: Why do novices miss their own errors?
options: They lack the internal standard to compare against
Error detection is only possible for experts
